combination

public static java.math.BigInteger combination(int n,
                                               int k)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Calculates the binomial coefficient C(n,k).
This method returns 0 if n = 0 and k > 0. It throws an IllegalArgumentException if any specified argument is negative.

Parameters:
n - A nonnegative integer
k - A nonnegative integer
Returns:
The binomial coefficient C(n,k).
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the specified arguments are negative (at least one of them)

multinomial

Calculates the multinomial coefficient.

Parameters:
m - The multinomial to calculate
Returns:
The value of the specified multinomial

pow

public static java.math.BigDecimal pow(java.math.BigDecimal b,
                                       int p,
                                       int q)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the result of bp/q as a BigDecimal.

This method is not defined for negative numbers, so b and p/q must be positive numbers. It throws a IllegalArgumentException when the exponent is negative or the base is negative.

Exceptional cases:

  • 0n = 0 for n > 0
  • 00 = 1


    Parameters:
    b - The base
    p - The numerator of the exponent
    q - The denominator of the exponent
    Returns:
    the result of bp/q
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the exponet is negative or the base is negative.
